title: Waistcoat, 1962-54-33, 1780–90
medium: Technique: Embroidery in chain stitch made with a tambour hook using 15 colors of silk on silk plain weave foundation.
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Panel containting the left and right fronts, lapel revers and button covers of a gentleman's waistcoat. Pattern of flowers and chinoiserie figures.

exhibitions.title: The Greenleaf Collection: Textile Arts from the 16th to early 19th century
